comment.body:
Seeing as I know first-hand that PlutoTV centers around live broadcasts, I'd both chip in on keeping an eye on how it can be fixed, *and* acknowledging that it won't be an easy one.

For anyone wondering, various versions of PlutoTV with the same GUI is in something like 40 countries by now, incl. the US.

comment.body:
Sorry for the mistake,

But maybe, it can not be blocked by using filters in Start because of its native behaviour.


Envoy  partir de Outlook pour Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>

________________________________
De : Franois-Rgis BONA ***@***.***>
Envoy : mardi, janvier 23, 2024 8:56:05 AM
 : AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters ***@***.***>; AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters ***@***.***>
Cc : Comment ***@***.***>
Objet : Re: [AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters] www.gentside.com (Issue #170996)

I think https filtering is working in Start app because all ads are blocked when this mode is activated excepted loading message in video frame.

But maybe, it can be blocked by using filters in Start because of its native behaviour.



Envoy  partir de Outlook pour Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>
________________________________
From: Adam ***@***.***>
Sent: Tuesday, January 23, 2024 8:49:23 AM
To: AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters ***@***.***>
Cc: frbona ***@***.***>; Comment ***@***.***>
Subject: Re: [AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters] www.gentside.com (Issue #170996)


As far as I can see, HTTPS filtering doesn't work in Microsoft Start app, so it rather cannot be fixed by filters.
Maybe on rooted devices moving AdGuard's CA certificate to the System store would fix it, but I'm not sure - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/adguardcert

By default HTTPS filtering is disabled for Start app (at least it was on my end) and after enabling it, websites still do not use AdGuard's certificate or have problem with loading.
Ads still can be blocked by DNS filtering in this case, but placeholders cannot be and on my end video player even didn't load.
But if it works correctly in other browsers then maybe it's not caused by filters, I don't know.

comment.body:
OK so i have to use either Chrome or another alternative browser in which https filtering is working.

Envoy  partir de Outlook pour Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>
________________________________
From: Adam ***@***.***>
Sent: Tuesday, January 23, 2024 9:08:42 AM
To: AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters ***@***.***>
Cc: frbona ***@***.***>; Comment ***@***.***>
Subject: Re: [AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters] www.gentside.com (Issue #170996)


By default HTTPS filtering is disabled for Start app (at least it was on my end) and after enabling it, websites still do not use AdGuard's certificate or have problem with loading.
Ads still can be blocked by DNS filtering in this case, but placeholders cannot be and on my end video player even didn't load.
But if it works correctly in other browsers then maybe it's not caused by filters, I don't know.

By default HTTPS filtering is disabled for Start app (at least it was on my end) and after enabling it, websites still do not use AdGuard's certificate or have problem with loading.
Ads still can be blocked by DNS filtering in this case, but placeholders cannot be and on my end video player even didn't load.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

Zmiana z:
```adblock
$image,domain=wp.pl|dobreprogramy.pl
```
na:
```adblock
$image,redirect=1x1-transparent.gif,domain=wp.pl|dobreprogramy.pl
```
powinna rozwiza problem.

These rules:
```adblock
pluto.tv#%#//scriptlet('json-prune', 'adBreaks.*')
pluto.tv#%#//scriptlet('xml-prune', 'xpath(//*[name()="Period"][.//*[name()="BaseURL" and contains(text(),"_ad")]] | //*[name()="Period"]/@start | //*[name()="Period"]/@duration', '', '.mpd')
```
should block these ads (at least work on my end).

pull_request.title: Remove JS rules used to set a cookie - 2024 Jan 23 part 2

issue.title: Getting rid of JS rules, used to set a cookie

labels.name: Infrastructure
labels.description: Related to the repository infrastructure

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

We have ~317 JS rules, used to set a cookie. They can be found by:
`document.cookie =`
They must be replaced by `set-cookie` / `set-cookie-reload` / `trusted-set-cookie-reload` scriptlet rules.

There are many old rules, so first you need to check if the site is available, and then the need for the rule.

* For convenience, you can work in a separate browser
* Retrieve the list of domains, clean up duplicates and check if sites exist (if redirects occur, we assume that the site is dead).
* All such rules can be merged into one file, convert them to exception rules and import as custom filter. Then go down the list and check if the rules are needed (other types of problems not related to these rules are skipped).
* If the site is dead - add domains in the comment below. Then we will remove them from the filters.

In order not to overlap with other filter maintainers, it is desirable to perform batch rule replacement via pull-requests (5-10 rules per PR).

### Important
It should be checked with a Dutch or German VPN, because otherwise the cookie usage messages may not appear.

issue.title: Google AdServices unblocked
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Helloz i noticed that `AdGuard Mobile Ads Filter` have unlocked `googleadservices` and would like to know why?
Does blocking it making apps crushes or is there any other reason why main ad service from google is unlocked?
Regards, NIGHTZNERO.

### Proposed solution

Guess,blocked?

### Additional information

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Helloz i noticed that `AdGuard Mobile Ads Filter` have unlocked `googleadservices` and would like to know why?
Does blocking it making apps crushes or is there any other reason why main ad service from google is unlocked?
Regards, NIGHTZNERO.

### Proposed solution

Guess,blocked?

```txt
# This rule will allow the top part to become selectable

```

</details>

comment.body:
If I understand everything correctly this domain is used for tracking in the mobile app. Lists of mobile trackers get into the common DNS filter. Please, try adding an exception 
`@@||ue.flipboard.com^` to DNS filter and adblock filter.

issue.title: Google AdServices unblocked

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Helloz i noticed that `AdGuard Mobile Ads Filter` have unlocked `googleadservices` and would like to know why?
Does blocking it making apps crushes or is there any other reason why main ad service from google is unlocked?
Regards, NIGHTZNERO.

### Proposed solution

Guess,blocked?

### Additional information

![Screenshot_20231026_230631_AdGuard](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/61750641/22665c56-3ea4-4cc8-9fd0-e5f5c4b76879)

comment.body:
> As I see, it's only needed for Google search to work correctly when using our DNS.

Thanks for clarification,



> In fact, you can block it via our Private DNS completely.

Yea ik,just wanted to know why ad service is unblocked and was thinking if this is blocked when some apps from Google will stop working but if its only needed to Google Search i will block it manually,thanks
@zloyden  This is their official store and somewhat analogous to sites having their official store in Amazon. So I guess the rules can be merged in Annoyances list to `##.p-sticky`.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Not just that, it will simply misbehave

The full rules I tried are (I needed to include ALL of it -- that resolves the issue perfectly):
```txt
! t.hi098123.com
@@||pagead2.googlesyndication.com/getconfig/$xmlhttprequest,domain=t.hi098123.com

@@||pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/managed/$script,domain=t.hi098123.com
||googleads.g.doubleclick.net/pagead/ads$frame,redirect=noop.html,domain=t.hi098123.com

@@||googletagmanager.com/gtag/$script,domain=t.hi098123.com
t.hi098123.com#$#ins.adsbygoogle * { height: 1px !important; visibility: hidden !important; }
t.hi098123.com#$##hi-notice { height: 1px !important; visibility: hidden !important; }

t.hi098123.com#@#.adsbygoogle-noablate
!@@||t.hi098123.com^$elemhide ! <=== This rule will not hide ANY element
!@@||t.hi098123.com^$jsinject
!@@||t.hi098123.com^$stealth
@@||t.hi098123.com^$urlblock
t.hi098123.com#$#iframe[src^="https://googleads.g.doubleclick.net/"]
t.hi098123.com#$#.adsbygoogle-noablate
t.hi098123.com#$##hi-notice

# This rule will allow the top part (bottom the topbar) to become selectable
t.hi098123.com#$#.tabad *, .tabad *[style] {display:inline!important;}

# This rule will prevent `Hi.notice()` from being called from an obfuscated script
t.hi098123.com#$#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'Hi.notice', 'noopFunc')

t.hi098123.com#$##hi-notice,#hi-notice,#hi-notice{margin:0px!important;}
```

Seems like this guy does it. As far as I know, the `~` part in the filter means to exclude those websites. `reklam` means advert in Turkish. `techolay.net/sosyal` is a forum site. The guy who founded `technopat.net/sosyal` (which is in the exclude list) found it.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

comment.body:
Regarding detection, maybe something like this (I couldn't reproduce redirection, so I'm not sure if it will works for this case too):
```adblock
t.hi098123.com#%#(()=>{window.addEventListener("message",(function(e){"goog:gRpYw:doubleclick"===e.data&&Object.defineProperty(e,"origin",{value:"https://googleads.g.doubleclick.net"})})),adsbygoogle=dataLayer={push:function(e){}},AG_onLoad((function(){const e=document.createElement("ins");e.innerHTML='<ins data-ad-status><iframe data-google-query-id src="https://googleads.g.doubleclick.net/"></iframe></ins><ins data-adsbygoogle-status><iframe id="google_esf"></iframe></ins>';const o=document.querySelector(".tabad > *");o&&(o.appendChild(e),setTimeout((()=>{postMessage("goog:gRpYw:doubleclick")}),10))}));})();
```
could be used.
It just an alternative solution which seems to works fine on my end without necessity of unblocking ads requests.
Though sometimes during navigation back/forward it doesn't work, it looks like that in such case the problem is that extension script is executed after website scripts and reloading website usually fixes it.
